definitions.definition: The atmosphere above a given point, especially as visible from the ground during the day.
definitions.example: That year, a meteor fell from the sky.

definitions.definition: The part of the sky which can be seen from a specific place or at a specific time; its condition, climate etc.
definitions.example: I lay back under a warm Texas sky.
This mortal has incurred the wrath of the skies.

definitions.definition: (theoretical physics) The set of all lightlike lines (or directions) passing through a given point in space-time.
In an art gallery, the upper rows of pictures that cannot easily be seen.
To hit, kick or throw (a ball) extremely high.
To clear (a hurdle, high jump bar, etc.) by a large margin.
To hang (a picture on exhibition) near the top of a wall, where it cannot be well seen.
To drink something from a container without one's lips touching the container.
A vibrant light blue colour, like that of the sky on a fine day.
To travel over (a slope etc.) on skis; to travel on skis at (a place), (especially as a sport)
